Posts.Content: 1osugrl wrote: I had a wire localized open excisional biopsy for ADH on 4/4/12 and felt pretty good until today.  Today i feel like i was hit by a truck.  Groggy, nauseous, exhausted.  Is this the side effects from general anethesia?  Anyone else out there who had the same feeling? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: post op excisional biopsy 1osugrl 1osugrl

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2012 11:51AM 1osugrl wrote: Thanks for the advice.  Maybe i just overdid it yesterday.  I felt so good yesterday and today i feel "hungover".  How long before this feeling goes away?  Cant wait to get my old energy level back.  The stress over this whole situation, which began with a mamogram in November, has really taken a toll on me.
Posts.Title: post op excisional biopsy 1osugrl 1osugrl

Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2012 11:59PM 1osugrl wrote: I also had a core needle biopsy on Feb 2nd.  I was diagnosed with Atypical Ductal Hyperplasia.  I will see the surgical oncologist on Monday.  I also was anxious, unable to eat or sleep.  The ladies here on this blog are wise and have much knowledge.  Ask your Dr for anti anxiety meds.  They really do help.
Posts.Title: Waiting for surgical biopsy sndlu49 debbie6122

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2012 10:07AM 1osugrl wrote: Hi rocklizard, Your story is so similar to mine.  I too had microcalcifications found on routine mamo back in Nov. Then was called back in Dec 2011 for magnified mamo of right breast. Then referred to a Breast Specialist in Jan 2012, then stereotactic biopsy in Feb, surgical oncologist in March, and finally a wire localized excisional biopsy last week.  The waiting has been excruciating... and the anxiety overwhelming as im sitting here waiting for the final pathology report. Could you send me that you Tube link on meditation and hypnotherapy?  I would surely appreciate it. Thanks!
Posts.Title: Scared out of my mind Shayne rocklizard

Posts.Content: Apr 13, 2012 03:43PM 1osugrl wrote: Hey Rocklizard, Thanks for the You Tube link.  It really does work as i listened and became so relaxed that i feel asleep.  Im still waiting, but dealing much better with the anxiety.  I had the excision for ADH.  My family practice doc gave me the preliminary results and she says it looks good.  She couldn't find any mention of carcinoma on the report.  She says the mass showed FEA. On Monday, i will see the surgeon for the final path report and get the plan for future screenings.  I feel so blessed that my results are not cancer.  My favorite aunt had her lumpectomy 2 weeks ago and she has IDC. She will need chemo and radiation. The OSU actually stands for Ohio State University. Thats my alumnus. Graduated in 1991 with a BS in nursing. Im a Big Ten girl who lives in Northern California...
Posts.Title: Scared out of my mind Shayne rocklizard
